channel.title: Research on Malay Dhamelia
channel.description: Recent content in Research on Malay Dhamelia

item.title: Resources to hack the research workflow
item.description: ChangeLog: 20-Sep-2020: Added python script to highlight pdf annotations Added Zettelkasten based foam-bubble 29-Jul-2020: Added connectedpapers.com 14-Jul-2020: Added Tiddlywiki 14-Mar-2020: Highly.co status as defunct. Twitter acquired highly.co (https://techcrunch.com/2019/04/17/twitter-highly/) 19-August-2019: Made the list The list contains a free softwares that aids in conducting research systematically. I believe that a document once read, a video once watched should be documented and stored systematically. Since consuming a stimulating piece of writing forms multiple connections in a researcher’s head, the storage system should not only store the documents and it’s whereabouts, but also should store the connections it has once formed.
